segment.source: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area
segment.target: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area

segment.source: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area
segment.target: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area

segment.source: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area
segment.target: How to Refresh Virtual Applications from the Desktop Notification Area

segment.source: To refresh the list of available applications and the associated shortcuts and file type associations, you must refresh the publishing information from the Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server or the Application Virtualization (App-V) Streaming Server before the applications appear on your desktop.
segment.target: To refresh the list of available applications and the associated shortcuts and file type associations, you must refresh the publishing information from the Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server or the Application Virtualization (App-V) Streaming Server before the applications appear on your desktop.

segment.source: You can accomplish this directly from the notification area on your desktop.
segment.target: You can accomplish this directly from the notification area on your desktop.

segment.source: To refresh the virtual applications from the client desktop
segment.target: To refresh the virtual applications from the client desktop

segment.source: Right-click the Application Virtualization System icon in the notification area.
segment.target: Right-click the Application Virtualization System icon in the notification area.

segment.source: Select Refresh Applications from the pop-up-menu.
segment.target: Select Refresh Applications from the pop-up-menu.

segment.source: Your desktop is updated, and the client reflects any changes in applications, shortcuts, and file type associations.
segment.target: Your desktop is updated, and the client reflects any changes in applications, shortcuts, and file type associations.

segment.source: This applies only when a publishing server has been defined.
segment.target: This applies only when a publishing server has been defined.

segment.source: How to Use the Desktop Notification Area for Application Virtualization Client Management
segment.target: How to Use the Desktop Notification Area for Application Virtualization Client Management
